archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.physloc: Please note: This collection is in off-site storage and requires 1-2 days notice for retrieval. Request boxes through the library's catalog, Addison, or contact Special Collections for more information.
did.abstract: The collection consists of professional papers compiled over the course of Huffman's career at Virginia Tech (1971-1991).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Stanley A. Huffman, Jr. Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Stanley A. Huffman, Jr., Papers, Ms1991-056, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Stanley A. Huffman, Jr. Papers were donated to Special Collections in 1991.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing and description of the Stanley A. Huffman, Jr., Papers was completed in October 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Over the course of his extensive career, Stanley A. Huffman, Jr. was a school teacher, administrator, professor, consultant, and producer of television programs for education with a particular emphasis on use of technology and media. He held degrees from Virginia Polytechnic Institute (now Virginia Tech) and the University of Virginia. From 1971 to 1987, he served as the director of the Learning Resources Center and from 1987 to 1991 he was the director of Distance Learning at Virginia Tech. Huffman died in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of professional papers compiled over the course of Huffman's career at Virginia Tech (1971-1991). A majority of materials are group in subject files. Other types of materials include correspondence, administrative paperwork, and presentation, conference and research files. In addition, the collection contains the manuscript for Huffman's 1969 book, Instructional Media.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is in its original order. For the most part, folders contain various subject files and materials from presentations and publications.
